newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Vivus, big techs weaker.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Vivus, big techs weaker.

text.p: Shares in Vivus Inc fell to 55-7/8 from 65-1/4 preceding Monday's U.S. market open after a report in the latest issue of Barron's questioned the rationale behind a recent, sharp run-up in the shares.
The February 24 Barron's article called into question the patient appeal and effectiveness of Vivus's MUSE anti-impotence compound.
In the past month, Vivus shares have shot up from around 40, buying stoked by the launch of MUSE and a medical study supporting its use, according to Barron's.
Elsewhere, traders said they expect and extension Monday of the recent decline in large-capitalization technology stocks.

Before Monday's open, many of the large-cap stock were trading down: Cisco Systems fell to 57-1/8 to 58-3/8, Intel declined to 144-1/2 from 146-3/8, Microsoft gave up 1/2 at 95-1/2 and 3Com slipped to 37-3/4 from 38-5/8.

Also, Security-Connecticut Corp shares are expected to jump at the market open after ReliaStar announced theacquisition of the company for $47 per share in stock, well above Security-Connecticut's 37-1/2 NYSE close Friday.
